ratings.comment: The course material is quite tedious, and it does not seem to be updated. Many techniques seem to be very old. I wish there are more state-space methods.

I love prof. Zinn! Amazing lectures with real world applications. He was aware that most students did not have the prereq of dynamic systems, so he spent over a month reviewing. Exams are like the homework and he is very honest about what each exam problem will entail. You can truly tell his passion for controls and teaching. Super approachable.

Second half of the class was harder than the first half. Zinn gives a reasonable amount of homework. His lectures weren't always focused on the most relevant material for the class but the example problems are good. Reasonable quizzes/exams. I liked the structure of the class.

Dynamics is a difficult class, but professor Zinn does lots of examples during lectures and there's lots of practice from the homework. The online homework is very hard but you get 100 tries per problem, and you cannot look at the next problem till you solve it. Tough grading, homework worth only 5%, 7 quizzes each worth 10%, and 1 final worth 25%.
Great professor. Anyone who disagrees shouldn't be taken seriously and didn't do well in the class

Professor Zinn is about as good of a STEM professor as you can get. He is very thorough in his explanations, he gives lots of examples and the class is formatted for student success. There's 6 quizzes, but you know the topics they will be on and they aren't too difficult. With Covid, he also helped to make it easier for us. He truly cares. Take him

Most of the grades is on the exams. We had 6 exams every 2 weeks but they were not that hard. No need to attend the lecture all semester long. You can check his slides and online videos of his lectures. And he actually specifies what you need to understand for the exams. You don't need to read the book, but you need to online website for the HW

Not very difficult subject material, but the textbook was not very useful and most of the material needed to be learned in lecture.  Proff. Zinn talks very fast and in a condescending manner.  He is probably a very good engineer/ researcher, but I did not find his teaching style very effective.
Overall good teacher for a tough subject. Lectures are clear and teacher is willing to help outside class.

A pretty tough class for everyone.  The grade are mostly depends on the quizzes, which are fine. You really need to get full grades on quizzes to get a A. The exams are so hard that they make you doubt life haha. Generally great professor. Check his degrees. God!

He's a great teacher. His class isn't easy, but he gives you opportunities to earn your grade. Study hard for the quizzes (40% of the overall grade) and make sure to attend lectures and discussions, as the examples are a vital part of the learning process. He's extremely brilliant and a good guy. Take his class, but don't expect to fly through it.

Professor Zinn was good at explaining the material in a clear and concise manner, always illustrating concepts with plenty of examples. A reasonable amount of effort is required to master the material, but this class wasn't exceptionally hard.

Material was pretty straight forward, but applying it to the problems presented the real challenge. Zinn is great at explaining things if you go into office hours. Makes a huge difference. Prepare well for the quizzes, as they're worth a large percentage of your grade.

Prof Zinn is a cool guy who knows the material and is going to challenge you on exams. The quizzes are usually easier (and thankfully are a larger part of the grade). The class is tough and is much more about applying material than memorizing it

Zinn is awesome. Cool guy who knows his stuff and wants his students to do well. The material isn't really that bad overall, but it's more about applying it to the problems that they give you, which can be very difficult at times

Zinn is a great professor for this pretty hard class. The exams are difficult but fair. Some of the quiz problems were really tough but the grading is generous. He is an extremely intelligent guy (Google him and see his experience in the industry) which makes you feel like you are really learning a lot in the class.
Really clear, gives out lecture slides that are helpful. Solid prof.
This is a tough class, don't let yourself get behind.  Five quizzes, drop the lowest one - 60% of your grade.  No midterms.  Professor Zinn is awesome.

He talks pretty fast and sometimes to himself but he's decent. If you ever have a problem go to his office hours. Exams are hard but focus on the quizzes more so b/c their a higher percentage of your grade and don't put off the hw.
Zinn is sick. Best teacher i've had so far. Funny as hell and wants you to do well

He made a difficult class understandable. He goes very fast but if you keep up (for the most part)things make sense. He always helps students and answers questions. He wants the students to learn which makes him a good teacher.

Hands out printed copies of ppt's before start of lecture- which is good b/c he talks fast and then you can focus on understanding what he's saying instead of copying down the multitude of equations you will see in this class. approachable, jokes around with students, does good ex's. he came from industry so he'll tell you what's actually relevant.
I had him during his very first semester teaching. After a rough start the class became much better. Overall a very good professor.
